content: Savings Investments Property Asked by Eugene TangAsked on 17 Jan 2019How do I buy a place/apartment/house for renting out at age 30?Iâ€™m a overseas singaporean student studying in UK and I will only be done with school at 26. My predicted starting pay is around 5k.1 answerAnswerBump1

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 17 Jan 2019In Singapore you mean? Well at that age you can only go for private property. And that's a verg high quantum and if you would have only started working in SG after you graduate, you may not have a lot of money in OA to leverage on. Plus you'll be giving up the chance to buy a BTO. I wouldn't suggest buying an investment home at all. Not here. It'll make more sense to invest in the markets or if you really want physical property, look to Bangkok or Vietnam properties. 0 comments0
